title: eider
text: illustrate , construct simplistic data, may , example, record patients attended GP associated complaints. practice, likely reading data file instead. example, CSV file called attendances.csv current working directory, just : eider allows mix match data sources, data CSV file R data frame: allows user , example, perform preprocessing portion data needed.
code: example_table <- data.frame(   patient_id        = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3),   attendance_reason = c(6, 6, 7, 6, 6, 7, 7, 7) )  data_sources <- list(attendances = example_table) data_sources_2 <- list(attendances = "attendances.csv") data_sources_3 <- list(   attendances = example_table,   # A variable which has already been constructed   other_data = "other_data.csv"  # A file to be read in )

title: eider
text: Suppose want extract feature corresponding total number times patient attended reason 6. eider requires feature specified JSON file, looks like : transformation_type tells kind overall operation performed. determines fields required JSON. source_file specifies name data source used list data sources. grouping_columns specifies columns group . absent_data_flag specifies data particular patient ID. output_feature_name specifies name column created output table. primary_filter filter object used select rows input table match particular conditions. Subsequent vignettes go detail different types transformations required JSON fields .

title: eider
text: obtain desired feature, can simply : expected, patients 1 2 attended reason 6 twice, patient 3 .
code: transform(   data_sources = data_sources,   feature_filenames = "example_attendances_6.json" ) #>   id total_attendances #> 1  1                 2 #> 2  2                 2 #> 3  3                 0

date and the first OR last date in the filtered table. — featurise_time_since

title:

First passes a table through a filter, then counts the time between a given
date and the first OR last date in the filtered table. — featurise_time_since
text: all_tables List input tables (passed read_data). spec list containing following elements: source_file:         Filename source table read . primary_filter:      filter object apply source table. date_column:         Name date column source table calculate time since. cutoff_date:         date calculate time since . from_first:          TRUE, calculate time since first date filtered table. FALSE, calculate time since last (recent) date filtered table. time_units:          Either "days" "years". number years defined number full 365.25 day periods two dates (rounded nearest whole number). output_feature_name: Name output column. grouping_columns:    Name columns source table group . absent_data_flag:    value use patients matching rows source table. context character vector used logging error messages. Defaults NULL.

what:
Given an ID column in a table, and a missing value, appends id-value pairs
for all values that are not in a second table. It is assumed that the IDs
are added to the 'id' column in the second table. — pad_missing_values
